metadata.title: CVE-2022-0759 kubeclient: kubeconfig parsing error can lead to MITM attacks (low)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in kubeclient, the Ruby client for Kubernetes REST API, in the way it parsed kubeconfig files. When the kubeconfig file does not configure custom CA to verify certs, kubeclient ends up accepting any certificate (it wrongly returns VERIFY_NONE). Ruby applications that leverage kubeclient to parse kubeconfig files are susceptible to Man-in-the-middle attacks (MITM).

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
tfm-rubygem-kubeclient is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
